usefulItems: 6 silicone muffin moulds, 12-hole muffin tray, bowl, wire rack, oven
title: Ham and cheese quinoa muffins

ingredients.content: 40 g cheddar cheese, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
20 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (1-2 cm)
2 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
1 spring onion/shallot, trimmed and cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
60 g zucchini, cut into pieces (3-4 cm)
40 g ham, cut into pieces (1-2 cm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Place 6 silicone muffin moulds into a muffin tray and set aside.
Place cheddar and Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Place water into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh quinoa into it, then cook <b>15 min/100°C/speed 4<b>. Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set quinoa aside to drain. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place parsley and spring onion/shallot into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add all remaining ingredients, including reserved cheese and drained quinoa, and combine <b>10 sec//speed 4<b>.
Transfer into muffin moulds and bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) or until golden. Allow to cool in tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Serve warm or cold.

hintsAndTricks: Use tri-coloured quinoa to add more colour and flavour to your muffins.
If you don't have silicone muffin moulds, grease your muffin tray well or use paper cupcake liners.
